jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

188416C72E7A4540B5FEA1782296FA29.description:
Decode regularly fingerspelled letter combinations (e.g., wh,
th, ph).

0647AD6FAC0B41C69C5AA35792CA11EC.description:
Decode fingerspelled words in context of other parameters
(e.g., NMS: #WHAT-q).

08277511014141BAA77D50E1A795574D.description:
Fingerspell untaught words drawing on phonemic awareness
and conventions.

35B7541FCB4C465C952126A19B603875.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

D9305EE71C9A4A769E6DFEFC841E5957.description:
Compare and contrast “families” of ASL signs that share the
same ASL handshape configuration as opposed to initialized
signs (e.g., HS F: CAT, STICK, BUTTON, and HAIR vs. FAMILY,
FOREIGN, FURNITURE).

AF6D192D256246FFA0AD7D32F719648F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

1787F92122C54DE0B5A1C89DBBEE2049.description:
Understand the role of fingerspelling in ASL and the multiple
uses of fingerspelling (e.g., emphasis #NO! and translation
“bus” into B-U-S or #BUS).

90E1AC70848B40BC8C0BDA5D43556A4C.description:
Use knowledge that every word spelled consecutively is
separated by a brief hold.

4C475C8CECCC4E1CB3999786818B375F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of ways fingerspelled signs are
formed and their uses.

1BD58BFD6EC4409B821525B76F322478.description:
Use signs and phrases acquired through conversations, signing
and being signed to, and responding to texts, including using
frequently occurring conjunctions and determiners to signal
simple relationships (e.g., DET-the, CL: 3-LIST).

C86BC168B5FE410CA828EC25533FC9BC.description:
With teacher scaffolding, understand and use figurative
language versus literal language using metaphors, similes,
and analogies (e.g., EAT-YOUR-WORDS, EYES-POP-OUT).

4B91A4510B8C4DC2BEB2C1CF0840CE75.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning through non-manual
markers (e.g., WORK-LONG-TIME nmm: teeth vs. WORKLONG-TIME nmm: pursed lips).

3E46D173CF1A452DA43CC2732F09BE9A.description: Identify real-life connections between signs and their use.

B30D973E62E343E2BAAAF0C3321FFF4D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring
verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites
(antonyms) (e.g., want/don’t want, like/don’t like).

6323B5FCE8DC49868A85D0FC5B5951D6.description:
Demonstrate understanding of sign families by relating
them to one another based on commonalities in parameters
(e.g., CHAIRPERSON, BOSS, CHIEF or HAPPY, INSPIRED,
EXCITED, DEPRESSED)

7E81E50DE6714B88AFBE2F848116D8CB.description:
With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate
understanding of sign relationships and nuances in sign
meanings.

DB9484F037B94FFEB042F9037F3E77F4.description:
Determine meanings of signs based on similar features (e.g.,
nose/beaks: DUCK, BIRD, EAGLE, PARROT).

CF66B5782337444CBFD880B5A7D81384.description:
Use knowledge of the meaning of individual signs to
predict the meaning of compound signs (e.g., BIRDHOUSE,
BOOKSHELF, DINING-ROOM)

45A93CD1902F497CB28B5AB21930BAD1.description:
Identify frequently occurring sign families and their
inflectional forms (e.g., large circular motion: long duration,
brain area: DREAM, THINK, PONDER).

BE73A00B0CF946D9AF57390F01401FF8.description:
Determine the meaning of the new sign formed when a
known prefix is added to a known sign (e.g., HAPPY/NOTHAPPY, TELL/AGAIN-TELL).

AE52263AFDC44C698BC89D753898F39B.description:
Use sentence-level context as clue to identify the meaning
of unknown signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases.

2E0019154ACE4F5998BA9D71E9F026F5.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases based on
grade 1 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from an array
of strategies.

069CBA4845AC4EA79E18B2721ACA5179.description:
Expand and rearrange sentences from a range of sentence
types.

517564513B794629BB669CD191EE9BC7.description:
Use the manipulation of non-manual markers in
topicalization.

AAC152B03601457399140E0748D28198.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., PLUS, OTHER,
THAT, list form, head nod).

FB4EE35FDAF5486A8B5D1AFFD1796FD4.description:
Produce simple sentences with indicating verbs using eye
gaze and locative signs.

9B9C07FB1B7D413884A8FAEAF92CB7C1.description:
Use frequently occurring descriptive classifiers and other
adjectives (e.g., DCL, ECL, SCL, ICL, BCL).

708143CAF13549D5A221D79D376180DC.description:
Use temporal signs to convey a sense of past, present, and
future (e.g., YESTERDAY I EAT, EAT I nms-NOT-YET).

CD6BEB292E234CA49D81017AA606B520.description:
Use common, proper, and possessive nouns. (e.g., name
signs, open palm to demonstrate possessiveness).

1374FD804F714AC7ADF20766A1B0907A.description:
Produce and expand complete simple and compound
declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory
sentences in response to prompts.

B93480E571314D719D7CB9F2B87AF460.description:
Understand how referents can be used to indicate
determiners, pronouns, conjunctions (e.g., indexing on nondominant hand).

F8AF77EC99EC4ECAB7E3220C7F8FFADC.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., KNOW, MOVEON, THAT; head nods, eye gazes).

2957D3378A3C484BAEA494ADFBA10A7F.description: Raise hands into signing frame space.

BE2920F3F8D543E7A87DF1FB69E2E048.description:
Demonstrate command of the structure of standard ASL
grammar and usage when signing (live and published).

87153E46F3ED479A839C43A8BF69E7C9.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and
situation. (See grade 1 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations)

DC029BDE9C314B1CA623020F8D641307.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when
appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

1B77DD16DB0F435EAE77BEA58E0F7933.description:
Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant
details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

D9E5E0B1E6534C4E89A774E9777843CA.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a signer says in order to
gather additional information or clarify something that is not
understood.

C58905B2E9B743FCBAC4110376CCCAA0.description:
Ask and answer questions about key details in storytelling or
storysigning or information signed or through other media.

66AC2910493043BD85050B88127F30F3.description:
Produce and respond appropriately to attention-getting
strategies.

E4FF967CC08943E789A810CBFF17F6B9.description:
Ask questions to clear up confusion about the topics and
videos under discussion.

EEDC3AB092A049DFA7DF0F0DB521AFB2.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the
comments of others through multiple exchanges.

286252AA95F0437CA67CAB9B7183D2B9.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., taking turns
signing about the topics and texts under discussion).

FEB58C8AAA814D3CBA59B6988D756155.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse
partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults
in small and larger groups.

32A779D97ADB402299146D1547EF6449.description:
With guidance and support, sign routinely over extended time
frames (e.g., time for research, reflection, and revision) and
shorter time frames (e.g., a single sitting or a day or two) for a
range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

300574C09A10413FB5F6781B4D9A080B.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information
from experiences or gather information from provided sources
to answer a question.

9D605D5254CC47DBAEB895CE0965FE21.description:
Participate in shared research and signing projects (e.g.,
explore a number of “how-to” resources on a given topic and
use them to sign a sequence of instructions).

7D050A61204D43E08F933CDE4E631FB4.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4FA74EBAEBAC421789840079D4C80717.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of
digital tools to produce and publish signing, including in
collaboration with peers.

2FF155BEEC734C6097B40FA90573E53B.description:
With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic,
respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add
details to strengthen signing as needed.

73046D3ED4514367A9EE4C9D9B89E922.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

6A97EADC6CEF464EB236C267AEA6C70A.description:
Sign narratives in which they recount two or more
appropriately sequenced events, include some details
regarding what happened, use temporal signs to signal event
order, and provide some sense of closure.

8C2ECB82CC1D4FD79A4264D179FE1EB1.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic,
supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of
closure.

8EA96DDC686B438BAA71FF5A734B402C.description:
Sign opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name
the text they are signing about, state an opinion, supply a
reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

AA9E4038E84A42F68601AB5582023526.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct sign recognition and
understanding, re-viewing as necessary.

223618B523F34121882B90C31E39139A.description:
View on-level text with accuracy, appropriate rate, and
expression on successive viewings for both published and
live texts.

8AA5113B26324CB793AA7715A62D8464.description: View on-level text with purpose and understanding.

7403D3F059C34D1FA3CA6982E92D58FC.description:
View and sign on-level texts with sufficient accuracy and
fluency to support comprehension.

95F4F6D2196C41C2BD85BD9CBF405C7E.description: Decode non-manual markers of new signs to determine their meanings (e.g., using BPCL: 2 and expression of exhaustion to decode EXHAUSTED).

0C5744580F504208873AA0AB40B5D9A4.description: Recognize the inflective changes in classifiers that influence their meanings (e.g., CL: 3-bumpy road).

0B1B886E41E94CEF886A4AADAD9CFF08.description: Use classifiers to show location of one object or person in relation to others (e.g., referents and prepositions).

1E49551A630B4BCBA307F9A9F54617CA.description: Recognize directionality changes in the meaning of a verb.

DBC37BDEBFF24991948499D76D63D06E.description: Recognize that movements and hold patterns change the meaning of a verb.

D0189425D8614611A4D571DA07193C87.description: Recognize the inflective changes in structure of signs that influence their meanings (e.g., comparatives, superlatives, plurality, temporal verbs: SIT-FOR-A-LONG-TIME, changes in subject and object: GIVE –BOOK, GIVE-CUP).

E4AFCCCBB09E4C868250C6141DE30D8C.description: Recognize the derivational changes in structure of signs that influence their meanings (e.g., noun and verb pairs, affixes, and sequences).

2BA88139BA0E4514A0BD5176E4FB65F7.description:
Know and apply grade-level sign analysis skills in decoding
signs.

28815CA31E2D411EB0F51C925A20C284.description: Decode meaning of signs using phonological awareness (e.g., PRINCE, KING).

0FECB747F854452892B099D469AD13DC.description: Demonstrate correct principles of numbering systems (i.e., cardinal numbers and ordinal numbers).

CE42638596CF495C95F8C13F444F29E8.description: Produce phonological groupings (sign families and patterns, e.g. positions of power at shoulder area: BOSS, CAPTAIN, COLONEL; feelings at chest area: HAPPY, ANGRY, THRILLED).

68D5C12302A2434AB54458033CB1B3C5.description: Segment signed words into their complete set of parameters.

204F0392860E426D9D07D71AB67B15C8.description: Isolate a single parameter while modifying other parameters.

0853C0BBB79448718A675DFFD2C36C20.description: Distinguish between handshapes and the manual alphabet.

3AB093EC8B4F4FB991E64834EEC7F6D4.description:
Demonstrate understanding of signs and parameters
(phonemes).

9D9A278AA05B40C5BA41743A03C3627F.description:
Use the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., eye gaze,
movement in starting a sign, body tilt, ending movement
or hold).

95C0C42487CF45E7B04E9C2A831BEEBC.description:
Recognize that signs are separated by movement and hold
patterns.

50D9123E92BF459FA2E3CD2E5E67605D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic
features of sign.

0AF96B4A2D4542FCBBE9D1DCE7A81B56.description:
With prompting and support, view informational texts
appropriately complex for grade 1.

DCE2BE08564D4F05A2482AEA1F3841DC.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

97023119C69D42C1A05F0FD55F417D33.description:
Identify basic similarities in and differences between two
texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or
procedures).

618DF2C476AB4A2FAB1676F22967F7FB.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

4BFFEE29F3EB436E92D34EAE5650CB03.description:
Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key
ideas.

20A0B27AD15E41178A3C9F0AF0C20BA1.description:
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other
illustrations and information provided by the fingerspelled
signs and signs in a text.

4FB4DC57D676444986D080F9B506C783.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., visual transition
effects) and text structures (e.g., sequence and transition
phrases) to locate key facts or information in a text.

E4A44DE45943477D934C0781F2EC9B29.description:
Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the
meaning of fingerspelled words, signs, and phrases in a text.

0372FA1D20F14D2CBE23535D77B32D76.description:
Describe the connection between two individuals, events,
ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

EDB3EDBD839F4A13919F9D0686A44EEC.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

CB92D5AB3CFB4504A220C346635BBE5F.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

47091DD6B1524E98B8102F66FA8D52FB.description:
With prompting and support, view prose and poetry of
appropriate complexity for grade 1.

3BC9C0BDC0BE4CC58624533E4EA2D4B6.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

2E245E0FF49F48C68B58AC488465C337.description:
Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of
characters in stories.

0D6A56B8301444F8BFC0C0A813C62FAD.description:
Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters,
setting, or events.

C1259CBCD73F4D68A5DC25E5C4B61A12.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

38C95BA2FDA84324BDCE6638528A18A9.description:
Explain major differences between text that tells stories and
text that gives information, drawing on a wide viewing of a
range of text types.

033BFF44436D40B2B62723A0531BEB8B.description:
Identify fingerspelled words, signs, and phrases, in stories or
poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

2C367250D56748A69A429A7A5CC2242C.description: Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.

72A21D397FB640A3A2DB5C333C5ED975.description: Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

2E84CC6E77BE474B838292DB1D29594A.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
